race.name: The Rad
race.tagline: High-desert climbing in southern Colorado. Spanish Peaks backdrop, 10,000+ feet of vertical.

vitals.registration: Opens via theraddirt.com. Tiered pricing by distance.
vitals.cutoff_time: Time limits per route with sweeps

climate.description: Early fall in Trinidad means cool mornings, warm afternoons. High desert sun plus altitude makes climbs hot.

terrain.primary: High-desert gravel with long sustained climbs
terrain.surface: Over 90% maintained gravel roads, short technical section at Trinidad Lake State Park

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Spanish Peaks scenery, 10K+ climbing at altitude. Life Time production quality. Overall +6 for adventure factor.

biased_opinion.summary: The Rad is a climbing race set against stunning Spanish Peaks scenery. The 18-mile climb to 9,000 ft with grades up to 18% defines the event. Well-organized Life Time production with challenging terrain.
strengths: The scenery: Spanish Peaks and sweeping mesas are stunning.
The climb: 18-mile sustained effort is a true test of climbing fitness.
The organization: Life Time event quality and support.
UNBOUND qualifier: Finishers earn qualifier coins for 2025.
weaknesses: Logistics: Trinidad is remote. Denver/Colorado Springs are hours away.
Altitude: 6,000-9,000 ft range affects sea-level riders.
Technical sections: Muddy/rutted descents can catch riders off-guard.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A serious climbing race in beautiful high-desert Colorado. Come prepared for altitude and long sustained efforts.

final_verdict.one_liner: High-desert climbing race with Spanish Peaks views and 10,000+ feet of vertical.
final_verdict.should_you_race: Yes if you love climbing and want a challenging altitude race in stunning Colorado scenery. The 18-mile climb is the real deal.
final_verdict.alternatives: If you want Colorado gravel without the massive climb: Ned Gravel. If you want similar climbing: Crusher in the Tushar.

logistics.airport: Denver (DEN) or Colorado Springs (COS) - several hours drive to Trinidad. Consider Pueblo for closer regional option.
logistics.lodging_strategy: Trinidad and surrounding area. Event weekend likely sells out local hotels/campsites. Book early.
logistics.food: Trinidad is a small town. Plan accordingly.
logistics.packet_pickup: Standard Life Time check-in protocols. Athlete guide covers timing and mandatory gear.
logistics.parking: Start in downtown Trinidad. Standard event footprint.

history.origin_story: Created by Life Time in Trinidad to showcase gravel roads rarely experienced, with Spanish Peaks backdrops and high-desert terrain. Lauren De Crescenzo won the inaugural 110-mile event.
notable_moments: Inaugural 2021 event established Trinidad as gravel destination
Was major series stop #6 in 2024 (dropped for 2025+)
2025 edition includes UNBOUND Gravel qualifier coin allocation
history.reputation: High-desert Colorado climbing race with stunning Spanish Peaks scenery. Long sustained climbs at altitude define the challenge.

course_description.character: Long sustained climbs through high-desert Colorado. Spanish Peaks views and 10,000+ feet of vertical define the challenge.

suffering_zones.label: Trinidad Lake Roller Coaster
suffering_zones.desc: Six-mile series of hills in the state park. Packs stay together but legs start to sting.

suffering_zones.label: 18-Mile Climb
suffering_zones.desc: The main selection. 18 miles up to 9,000 ft with grades up to 18%. Heat, altitude, and gradient blow up groups.
suffering_zones.terrain_detail: Long sustained climb with steep pitches

suffering_zones.label: Highest Point & Descent
suffering_zones.desc: After climbing to the highest point, screaming descent with mud and deep do-not-change-your-line ruts for about a mile.

suffering_zones.label: Chunky Sector
suffering_zones.desc: The chunkiest part of the course. Most susceptible to flatting. Right before fast run-in to town.

course_description.signature_challenge: The 18-mile climb to 9,000 ft. Long, steep, at altitude. This is where races are won and lost.

logistics.explanation: Race hub operates from 218 W Main St for drop bags and awards, with clearly structured inbound support timing. Aaron Bible noted being "shocked" by Trinidad's downtown revitalization when picking up his race packet. Life Time's production standards show through organized aid station placement, though some basic travel logistics remain unspecified.

length.explanation: The 112-mile Stubborn Delores course with 10,400 feet of climbing is described as being "for the hardiest" riders. Elite racing stayed bunched through 46 miles before the field finally broke apart, with Vermeulen and Stetina's sprint finish coming after 68 miles of sustained effort. Distance plus elevation creates cumulative difficulty that separates prepared riders from the rest. Among the longest in gravel, comparable to Badlands.

technicality.explanation: Course features "a mix of pristine and punchy gravel" with technical sections including "gnarly climbs through town" and "a sporty descent in the last quarter mile" that allowed Vermeulen to overtake Stetina at the finish. Aaron Bible valued his test bike's "slack geometry" for confidence "where the terrain and surface is bound to be dynamic." Mostly smooth with strategic technical challenges. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: The 112-mile course delivers 10,400 feet of climbing through "55 miles of gradual climbing" followed by descending sections and "a pretty brutal climb on blacktop" near the finish. Elite fields stayed together through the sustained climbing before breaking apart in the final third. Even the 47-mile option packs 4,200 feet of gain with maximum elevation of 7,221 feet. Among the hilliest in gravel, comparable to Badlands.

climate.explanation: Aaron Bible reported that "as the day went on the wind picked up and made for a challenging end of the race," creating deteriorating conditions for later finishers. September weather in southern Colorado at elevation can shift throughout the event day. Wind becomes a significant tactical factor in the latter portions of the course. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Racing reaches 7,221 feet on the shortest course, with longer distances climbing higher through the Spanish Peaks region. The sustained climbing through thin air adds cumulative stress beyond just the elevation gain numbers. Not Leadville-level altitude punishment, but enough oxygen deficit to matter when combined with the substantial vertical gain. Higher altitude racing, comparable to SBT GRVL.

adventure.explanation: Racing through the Spanish Peaks region delivers backcountry Colorado adventure with towering peaks and expansive mesa views. Trinidad's artistic culture and the technical South Shore Trail section add character beyond typical gravel grinding. The elevation and remote location create wilderness exposure without being completely isolated.

prestige.explanation: Lauren de Crescenzo has won twice including the inaugural 2021 edition, with 2024 bringing elite talent like Vermeulen, Stetina, Lachlan Morton, and Alex Howes. The event draws "more than a thousand" riders "from 46 states and nine countries" but remains newer in Life Time's portfolio. Elite participation is growing but the race hasn't established deep historical prestige yet.

race_quality.explanation: Life Time's production shows through systematic course changes year-over-year and structured aid stations with clear timing. The finish downtown creates spectator-friendly racing that enabled Vermeulen's last-quarter-mile sprint victory over Stetina. Michelle Duffy Smith notes the "exceptional experience" created through collaboration with Trinidad community partners.

experience.explanation: Racing through the Spanish Peaks region with expansive mesas as backdrop delivers Colorado high country experience. Trinidad offers 'rare, artistic and diverse culture' for post-race exploration. The technical loose gravel section on South Shore Trail near Trinidad Lake State Park breaks up what could be monotonous grinding.

community.explanation: Life Time membership perks and early registration access create some insider dynamic. Part of the broader Life Time gravel series with UNBOUND and Big Sugar, but hasn't earned its own distinct tribal identity yet.

field_depth.explanation: With a field of 500+ riders across distances, elite men's racing featured Vermeulen, Stetina, Morton, Howes, and Beers in the lead group, while women saw de Crescenzo, Anthony, Skarda, and Thompson contending. The field includes "seemingly every type of rider, pros and amateurs alike" with international participation. Competitive depth is growing but the newer event hasn't yet established the decades-deep talent pool of established races. Similar competitive depth to Rule of Three.

value.explanation: Three distance options from $85-195 provide entry points for different commitment levels, while UNBOUND qualifier opportunities add value for series-focused riders. Trinidad's transformation into an outdoor recreation destination with "newly established Office of Outdoor Recreation" creates broader weekend value. The town's "welcomed us with open arms" approach enhances the overall experience beyond just race day.

expenses.explanation: Trinidad isn't a destination resort town, which keeps accommodation costs manageable compared to Aspen-type Colorado locations. However, no specific lodging or airport information available means you're researching logistics yourself. Southern Colorado location requires travel commitment for most riders but isn't as remote as some backcountry options. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Pirelli Cinturato Gravel M
primary.why: Mixed-terrain specialist. Balanced grip and speed for variable conditions.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

The Rad is the sixth of seven races of the Life Time Grand Prix, where 35 women and 35 men are competing for $250,000, and where any rider can register to ride one of three distances. In this video, I give you a preview of the long course, the 114-mile Stubborn Delores route that the Grand Prix races and many others will tackle on September 30 in Trinidad, Coloardo.

---

videos.title: 2024 Life Time The Rad Dirt Fest | RACE HIGHLIGHTS
videos.description:
Watch the extended highlights of the 2024 Life Time The Rad Dirt Fest, stop #5 of the Life Time Grand Prix presented by Mazda. Set in the rugged and stunning landscapes of Trinidad, Colorado, this scenic gravel race challenges athletes with grueling climbs, technical two track sections, and fast paced descents. Returning champions Alexey Vermeulen and Lauren De Crescenzo seek to defend their titles while LTGP leaders Keegan Swenson, Sofia Gomez VillafaÃ±e are on a quest to lock up the overall. Other race favorites like Pete Stetina, Griffin Easter, Cecily Decker, and Alexis Skarda will also challenge for the coveted RAD guitar that goes home with the winner. Alongside them, over a thousand amateur riders take on the 110, 70, and 40-mile courses, pushing their limits in one of the most unique and funky events of the season.

Learn more about the Life Time Grand Prix: https://www.lifetimegrandprix.com

Learn more about the Rad Dirt Fest: https://www.theraddirt.com

videos.title: 2 hours 7 minutes of The Rad Dirt Fest 2024 - 70 Mile Course
videos.description: This was a really nice event and a great day out on the bike. My group took 2 wrong turns throughout the day and I had 3 chain drops. I also didn't have my 2 smallest gears so I had to really power through the climbs at low cadence sometimes.

videos.title: A BAD DAY at the Rad - 2023 Rad Dirt Race Recap
videos.description:
While the course was amazing, the legs were not, and this was the worst race of the season for me. However, everyone has their bad days, and this was mine. Here's the story of how it went down at the 2023 Rad Dirt Fest presented in Trinidad Colorado.

FOLLOW JOE GOETTL
Instagram - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jgoettl2.0/?hl=en
Website - https://www.goettlmedia.com/
Strava for this race - https://www.strava.com/activities/9954587398

SUPPORTERS
Scheels Sandy Utah - www.scheels.com
Wahoo Fitness - www.wahoofitness.com
Branden Scheel Racing - www.brandenscheelracing.com

Thank You For Watching!! 

If you've enjoyed this video and wish to SUPPORT US, the best way is to use the "give thanks" feature on the video to send us some love.

videos.curation_reason: First-person race recap with detailed race experience and course-specific challenges like the narrow choke point.

quotes.text: It's almost immediately on the dirt heading out towards Trinidad Lake State Park where the road turns quickly to a pretty rowdy rough two-track like a Jeep track with some big rocks. It's a full buffet sampler of all the things - all the conditions, all the surfaces including pavement, sand, mud and rocks.

In general, what I like about the course here is it's that champagne gravel most of the time. It's almost a little desert-like - it's dry and dusty, with most of the roads being gravel, hard packed, very fast, very flowy, very moderate gravel.

At Mile 3.8 there is a little choke point where we go between two fences and only a single rider can get through at a time - everybody knows this so we're all trying to be right at the front right at that spot which is going to make for some pretty hectic racing.
